main event: The document describes a UFO sighting in Dallas, Texas on December 9, 1952. An object was observed at 1500 feet and seen moving rapidly from west to east at an estimated speed of 500 to 800 mph. It disappeared from sight after 15 to 20 seconds.
interesting points: The witness was a civilian pilot with approximately 1,200 hours of flying time.
The phenomenon was tracked at a distance of 2222 to 4222 yards range, appearing intermittently at different azimuth locations.
An intensively visual search was made, but the phenomenon was not seen by the pilot or any crew members.
The report includes photographs of the APG-41 radar scope, which indicated the presence and trackability of the phenomenon.
No air traffic was observed in the Dallas area at the time of the sighting.
witnesses: civilian pilot with 1,200 hours of flying time
